message: something seems quite wrong with this whole situation. I totally get the learning about all cultures and religions and as many put it I am a """"liberal"""" but even i see the wrong in this action. They could have chosen any phrase or word for calligraphy both arabic and persian have beautiful calligraphy writings that does not have such deep religious meaning. I can mostly relate to the parent for being spooked about the whole issue. I wouldn't threaten the school staff and get all crazy about it though. I am not religious but I would be weirded out if a teacher teaches my kid something so religious without explaining the meaning or trying to understand the effect of it on others.. wrong move on teachers part for sure.

Even after endorsing Trump, many Republicans are finding themselves constantly forced to distance themselves from Trump's inflammatory statements. Saying they disagree is beginning to sound hollow so Republicans have taken another tack. They promise that the courts and Congress will safeguard the United States from Trump's authoritarian whims. If the New York businessman begins carrying out an agenda from the White House that looks anything like the one he's proposed on the campaign trailâ€“ like a ban on Muslims â€“Republicans promise the Constitution guarantees there will be a check and a balance. In other words, Republicans are saying their nominee is so awful that they need to reassure fearful Americans that they will â€œstep inâ€ to contain him, should he ever become President. As Fox notes, Mitch McConnell, John McCain and top Republican strategists have all echoed this point during the last few days, apparently operating under the delusion that a Party that has accomplished absolutely nothing legislatively during the past eight years could somehow be counted on to take on an aberrant and malevolent Executive Branch. Thatâ€s not only pathetic, itâ€s sick, as many were quick to point out: """"One might think that if you are suggesting that the country is strong enough to constrain a potentially authoritarian leader, it might be a good idea not to elect that potentially authoritarian leader in the first place,""""

When I gave birth to my daughter THREE MONTHS EARLY, my husband and I were scared 21 year old kids who had been married two weeks. One of the best nurses I had sported full sleeve tattoos and dark (almost goth) makeup. She was fantastic. She sat with my husband and I and walked us through every step of a preemie's birth to what would happen in the NICU. She even got us a card congratulating us on our marriage and baby. Fast forward to after the birth (at 3 am) and I was recovering well, baby was in NICU and fine, and her shift ended and a new nurse took over. The new nurse may have dressed well and """"looked classy"""" but she was awful. She had the audacity to want to wake up my exhausted husband because he fell asleep wearing the OR scrubs and she didn't want him stealing them. WHAT THE HECK?! Seriously?! I almost died, my husband could have very well lost both baby and I and she's concerned that he didn't take off the scrubs before he fell into a comatose sleep? She sucked. I'll take tattoos and a sweet disposition any day over a high end snob. PS-He gave the scrubs back after he woke up and showed and our daughter is a beautiful 15 year old honor student.
